document_title: Otitis externa: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Outer ear infections are often caused by bacteria. The most common pathogenic bacteria are S. aureus and S. aureus [MRSA].
But fungi are also a common cause of external ear canal fungus, especially the fungi species Aspergillus niger and Candida albicans.(3)
In addition, skin diseases or allergic reactions, such as an allergy to shampoo, can also lead to otitis externa.
subsection_title: viem tai ngoai.json. Causes of otitis externa

viem tai ngoai.json. Causes of otitis externa
Outer ear infections are often caused by bacteria. The most common pathogenic bacteria are S. aureus and S. aureus [MRSA].
But fungi are also a common cause of external ear canal fungus, especially the fungi species Aspergillus niger and Candida albicans.(3)
In addition, skin diseases or allergic reactions, such as an allergy to shampoo, can also lead to otitis externa.
